Text.Value: A survivor. A remnant. An illithid.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES]*REUSE* [Raphael] He snaps his fingers and the hammer appears before him.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: |Raphael snaps his fingers and the hammer appears before him.|
EditorData.SFXTags: [MO] Finger Snap + Hammer Appearance and pickup.

Text.Value: Refuse me, and you'll soon know for sure.
The city will burn - your world will die. But you will persist, a grey shadow. Without beauty, without heart, without self.
Sounds great - I might finally find some peace.
Sounds great - I might finally find some peace.
Why must you be so stubborn?
There's no maybe about it.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES]  [Player] signs the floating contract [Raphael] pops the Orphic Hammer into existance (also floating) and the player takes it.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Tthe player signs the floating camera (back to camera), and then Raphael pops the Orphic Hammer into existance (also floating) and the player takes it.
EditorData.SFXTags: [MO] Contract Disappearance + Finger Snap + Hammer Appearance and pickup.

Text.Value: Then maybe this is the end.
Then maybe this is the end.
Beautiful. With that single word you may have saved a billion lives - your own among them.
The grand finale has arrived, my friends, and thanks to you, I have a ringside seat.
And not for the first time. Your clumsy snooping in my House of Hope did not go unnoticed - the stench of deceit lingers so.
That may be. When the screaming stops and your mind is gone, the rest, perhaps, is silence.
I'd prefer to avoid that - what can I do?
I'd prefer to avoid that - what can I do?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES] [Raphael] He summons a floating contract, whcih appears in a burst of flames.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raphael summons a floating contract, whcih appears in a burst of flames.
EditorData.SFXTags: [MO] Finger Snap + Contract Appearance + Contract Signing.

Text.Value: How undignified. I prefer business to begging. You have brought yourself low.
Dwelling in the ashes of dead worlds or in the space between stars, you will wander, endless. One among billions.
I'm willing to negotiate.
I'm willing to negotiate.
*At any other moment, the Crown of Karsus might seem too high a price. But to a desperate soul, Raphael's offer might even be considered charitable.*
Simple.
The Orphic Hammer. You misplaced it.
Never.
Never.
Free Orpheus and follow his lead. Then give that Netherbrain hell.
You don't need to like it - you're doing the right thing.
But I'll make sure the bards don't hear about this little moment of negligence. After all - we're associates in this great endeavour.
Goodbye. It has been... unforgettable.
I provide the Orphic Hammer, with which you can free Prince Orpheus.
Save yourself.
I have been more than generous in my dealings with you, and if you'd only listened, the brain would be dead, and you'd be sampling the contents of my wine cellar even now.
*He's telling the truth - you've never been more sure of anything.*
Hmm - perhaps.
If you refuse me, in mere moments, the thing that you've dreaded will finally come to pass.
I don't like this, but I don't have a choice. Deal.
I don't like this, but I don't have a choice. Deal.
Then maybe this is the end.
Then maybe this is the end.
What do you need me to do?
What do you need me to do?
It's going to be beautiful.
It's going to be beautiful.
Tell me what you need me to do.
Tell me what you need me to do.
Not this time.
The world's clock is winding down.
Planning to spend these last moments mocking me?
Planning to spend these last moments mocking me?
This is really too perfect.

EditorData.NodeContext: amused - he's just appeared to the players in a climactic moment when they thought they were doomed, and he has the upper hand

Text.Value: Not a chance.
Not a chance.
The great hero of Baldur's Gate! Conqueror of the Netherbrain. Your deeds will be timeless.

EditorData.NodeContext: not quite sarcastic, but he's puffing up the players for a fall

Text.Value: I'll find another way - I always do.
I'll find another way - I always do.
The blows you struck against the gods themselves will echo down through the ages.

EditorData.NodeContext: spinning a grand tale with a sting coming later

Text.Value: But I assure you, enjoying the spectacle will be quite beyond you.
In mere moments, all that you have dreaded will come to pass.
One of your companions is already lost - you will suffer the same fate.
Listen. Tune your minds beyond the frequency of the Prism's psychic collapse, and you can hear the sonorous, metronomic tick before the final tock.
And nobody will ever know that your feeble-minded negligence almost doomed the world in the last moment.

EditorData.NodeContext: and here's the sting - he just built up the players as heroes, but is reminding them that they have made a minor error that could doom them

Text.Value: Then in mere moments all that you've dreaded will finally come to pass.
I would love to, but you've already made quite a mockery of yourself.
But that's all done with. Now, I dictate the terms, and you agree to them. Master and vassal.
Deal.
Deal.
It seems the aspiring heroes of Baldur's Gate have backed themselves into a rather uncomfortable corner.
NO MORE NEGOTIATIONS!
I'm begging you, Raphael. HELP.
I'm begging you, Raphael. HELP.
And when the brain is defeated, you seize the Crown and give it to me. Refuse, and I'll take your souls instead.
Your absent-mindedness pains me more than your clumsy snooping in my home.
We could have been allies, partners... friends.
I'll come to collect the Crown when you've triumphed.
*So it comes to this - the devil's final offer. And your last chance to face the Netherbrain and survive.*
When the ballads are composed and the history books are written, they'll commemorate your battle across the High Hall.

EditorData.NodeContext: spinning a grand tale with a sting coming later

Text.Value: You're going to do exactly what I tell you to, or in mere moments, the thing you've dreaded will finally come to pass.
You have already become illithid, but you do not yet know what it is to be illithid. Soon, you will be a fragment of the hivemind, nothing more.

Synopsis:
The player has burned their bridges. They attacked the Emperor, causing him to leave the Astral Prism as a foe, and they have no hammer to free Orpheus, as they need his protection against the influence of the Netherbrain. After a short pause to let the players feel the weight of their actions, Raphael appears before them, with a new deal: accept the hammer from Raphael, freeing Orpheus in exchange for giving him the Crown. 

At this point, the player has no other option except for a game over.
